DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the evolution of the non specific symptoms for 116 patients with mild primary hyperparathyroidism before and 3, 6 and 12 months after surgery. A clinical score predicting clinical improvement at one year will be created.
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation of Non Specific Symptoms and Quality of Life Before and After Surgery for Mild Primary Hyperparathyroidism
DOC.criteria: Subjects with known moderate HPTI will be considered for participation. Patients with sporadic mild HPTI defined by: calcemia > 2.6 mmol/L , PTH > 25 ng/L and creatininemia < 160µmol/L OR calcemia between 2.5 and 2.6 mmol/L and PTH > 35 ng/L calcemia ≤2.85 mmol/L urine calcium level / 24 hours < 10 mmol (400 mg), decrease of the creatinin's clearance : 30% lower than normal population with the same age patients younger than 50 patients who can't be followed familial hypercalcemia multiple endocrinal neoplasia treatment with lithium or thiazides impossibility for the patient to complete the forms impossibility to follow the patient patient with serious disease which impact the quality of life
